Great video. I have an inherent distrust of digital currency like Bitcoin. 
To me, anything that exists strictly in digital form can be manipulated 
(like other currencies, stocks, ETFs, etc). I don't care about the 
programming used and the precautions taken - someone will find a flaw and 
exploit it. When it does get exploited, the results will be catastrophic. 
We'll see what happens but I'll side with Junius on this one.﻿

perhaps recommendations and what to look out for.. thanks.. your still my 
favorite weirdest named utube channel... thank you for your efforts.. its 
appreciated more then you know.﻿

don't own it." It seems to me that applies perfectly to Bitcoin. Who wants

to heart. Well done, sir.﻿

Larry Summer's interest is a cause for concern but not the way you 
interpret it. He would want to create a regulated blockchain to control 
people. Blockchain technology is a tool that allows secure exchange of 
tokens. Guns are a tool that allows transfer of kinetic energy from a 
distance. Would you suggest that guns should be avoided because Hitler has 
started to produce them to build an army? The best outcome for individual 
freedom involves mass adoption of unregulated blockchain technology before 
governments mandate their "mark of the beast" regulated global blockchain 
currency. It isn't the tools that are to be feared but the collectivists 
using them to enslave.﻿

I was never able to rap my head around bitcoin. It seemed just too elusive, 
kinda like the value of the us dollar only more so. 

MATH PROBLEM:
When I was a kid, a candy bar was 10 cents, a new Buick 3K. And about every 
time I got ten years older, things doubled in price. So now I'm paying $1 
for my Three Musketeers and 45k for my Buick (if they still make them).

If I live another 22 years how much will that candy bar and car cost me?
My answer made me laugh. And I said naw, but its true.

10 cent pieces were silver when I was a kid. That same dime is now worth 
about $1.60. Had I not spent those 3 thousand Liberty Peace Dollars on that 
Buick, I'd now have 51 thousand (actually it would be $70,000, their about 
6 bucks over spot). 
So, the dollar is a piece of crap, worth about 10 cents in my experiences 
and age. Yet the silver held. Even when it was stagnated for 20 plus years.

I will offer a bet 2 to 1 that bitcoin will not exist in 20 years.

Just my .02 cents worth....for what that's worth﻿
